definition: to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half

sentences.english: The scientist didn't have supper until he finished the work at midnight.
sentences.chinese: 这位科学家直到深更半夜完成这项工作才吃饭。

sentences.english: He was annoyed at the noise from the construction site in the midnight.
sentences.chinese: 他讨厌深更半夜从建筑工地上传来的噪音。

sentences.english: Deep more midnight, come to return to return you tired not tired?
sentences.chinese: 深更半夜，来来回回你累不累啊？

sentences.english: He was standing there by night like one intent on doing evil.
sentences.chinese: 他深更半夜默不作声站在那里，好像是来干坏事的。

sentences.english: She often plucks the strings of a guitar at night.
sentences.chinese: 她常在深更半夜弹吉他。

sentences.english: The young people were still abroad at the dead of night.
sentences.chinese: 这些年轻人深更半夜还在外边。

sentences.english: We went swimming at midnight just for the hell of it.
sentences.chinese: 我们深更半夜去游泳，只是为了好玩而已。

sentences.english: He heard hurried footsteps at dead of night.
sentences.chinese: 深更半夜时，他忽然听到匆匆的脚步声。

sentences.english: SONG Huai why middle of the night into Hong home?
sentences.chinese: 宋怀为什么深更半夜闯进张红家？

definition: in the depth of night/late at night
in the depth of the night/very late at night
midnight/in the middle of the night
lit. the black sky of midnight/very late at night (idiom)
a single man and a single woman/bachelors/a man and a woman together (typically in a secluded setting)
perfectly all right/without rhyme or reason
first thing in the morning/at daybreak
